bibl.title: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Howard A. Kelly, December 15, 1906

div1.p: Von Mansfelde agrees in principle with Kelly, but will not cease promoting Carroll. He suggests Kelly write the Secretary of Agriculture and Senator Dirk.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Howard A. Kelly, December 15, 1906
div1.opener:
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
Washington, D.C.
December 15th 1906.
Howard A. Kelly MD.
Baltimore. Md.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
I am in receipt of your letter of the
12th. I am in entire harmony with the
Sentiment of your letter. i.e. not to detract
from Walter Reed's credit; but to built recog-
nition of James Carroll on his great work-
We differ only in one respect: namely I will not
stop short under any consideration to see jus-
tice done to Carroll and Mrs Lazear.

Now, if you truly love the memory of Reed
help Carroll; that will be the only way to
show your estimation of both. A letter to the
Secretary of Agriculture from you now, and to
Senator Dirk will do much. There will be two
new bills introduced at once in House and
Senate by Senator Dirk and the medical mem-
bers of the House to elevate Dr Carroll to
the a leutenant Colonelcy; and the Secretary
of Agriculture told me an hour ago that he
is convinced of the value of the services of
Dr Carroll and will willingly do all in his
power to serve him and is at the pleasure of
Senator Dirks wishes in this matter.

I think I have done my part; now will
you people here at home do yours?
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours. AFMansfelde.
Chairman, Special Com.
Carroll affair Nat Leg.
Council A.M.A.. When your new addition of “Walter Reed appears
I shall take pleasure of reviewing it in
Western Medical Press circles.
Again
AFM.
